content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of 8 building blocks arranged in 4 distinct layers:
- Bottom layer (1st): 2 blocks (green cube, orange cube)
- Second layer: 2 blocks (orange cube, green cube)
- Third layer: 3 blocks (blue cube, green rectangular piece, orange cube)
- Top layer (4th): 1 block (orange triangular roof piece)

## Spatial Relationships
- Bottom layer: Green cube on right side, orange cube on left side
- Second layer: Orange cube on right side, green cube on left side (alternating pattern from first layer)
- Third layer: Blue cube on left, small green rectangular piece in middle, orange cube on right
- Top layer: Orange triangular roof piece sits atop the third layer, primarily over the blue cube

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:
- 2× Green cube (index 2)
- 3× Orange cube (index 3)
- 1× Blue cube (index 1)
- 1× Blue rectangular block (horizontal orientation) (index 8)
- 1× Orange triangular roof piece (index 12)

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 2
  Step2: Move block with index 3
  Step3: Move block with index 2
  Step4: Move block with index 3
  Step5: Move block with index 1
  Step6: Move block with index 8
  Step7: Move block with index 3
  Step8: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly builds the structure from bottom to top, starting with the green and orange cubes at the base, then adding the alternating second layer, followed by the third layer with the blue cube, small blue rectangular block, and orange cube, and finally placing the triangular roof piece on top.
